description: a(1)=3; for n>1, a(n) is smallest positive integer such that a(1)^2+...+a(n)^2 = m^2 for some m.
links: Vincenzo Librandi, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..100
mathematica: f[n_]:=Module[{a={3}}, Do[AppendTo[a,First[y/. {ToRules[Reduce[{y^2+a.a == x^2,x>0,y>0}, {y,x},Integers]]}]], {n-1}]; a]; f[21]//Timing (* _Jean-Fran√ßois Alcover_, Jan 26 2007 *)
prog: (PARI) print1("3, "); s=9; for(n=1,30, d=divisors(s); t=d[#d\2]; q=(s\t-t)/2; print1(q,", "); s+=q^2); \\ _Max Alekseyev_, Nov 23 2012
author: Charles Reed (charles.reed(AT)bbs.ewgateway.org)
